com.software.reuze

Class a_CellWorld<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.a_CellWorld<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the type of content for the Cells in the world.

    public class a_CellWorld<C>
extends Object
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 645.

    A representation for the environment depicted in figure 17.1.

    Note: the x and y coordinates are always positive integers starting at 1.
    Note: If looking at a rectangle - the coordinate (x=1, y=1) will be the bottom left hand corner.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Ravi Mohan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      a_CellWorld(int xDimension, int yDimension, C defaultCellContent)
      Construct a CellContent World with size xDimension * y Dimension cells, all with their values set to a default content value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • a_CellWorld

        public a_CellWorld(int xDimension,
           int yDimension,
           C defaultCellContent)
        Construct a CellContent World with size xDimension * y Dimension cells, all with their values set to a default content value.
        Parameters:
        xDimension - the size of the x dimension.
        yDimension - the size of the y dimension.
        defaultCellContent - the default content to assign to each cell created.

    • Method Detail

      • getCells

        public Set<ga_CellPositionAndContent<C>> getCells()
        Returns:
        all the cells in this world.

      • result

        public ga_CellPositionAndContent<C> result(ga_CellPositionAndContent<C> s,
                                  a_CellWorldAction a)
        Determine what cell would be moved into if the specified action is performed in the specified cell. Normally, this will be the cell adjacent in the appropriate direction. However, if there is no cell in the adjacent direction of the action then the outcome of the action is to stay in the same cell as the action was performed in.
        Parameters:
        s - the cell location from which the action is to be performed.
        a - the action to perform (Up, Down, Left, or Right).
        Returns:
        the CellContent an agent would end up in if they performed the specified action from the specified cell location.

      • removeCell

        public void removeCell(int x,
              int y)
        Remove the cell at the specified location from this CellContent World. This allows you to introduce barriers into different location.
        Parameters:
        x - the x dimension of the cell to be removed.
        y - the y dimension of the cell to be removed.

      • getCellAt

        public ga_CellPositionAndContent<C> getCellAt(int x,
                                     int y)
        Get the cell at the specified x and y locations.
        Parameters:
        x - the x dimension of the cell to be retrieved.
        y - the y dimension of the cell to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the cell at the specified x,y location, null if no cell exists at this location.
